Class BatchConsole

  • java.lang.Object
    • BatchImageEngine
      • BatchConsole
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<MetaMedia>

    public final class BatchConsole
extends BatchImageEngine

    This class creates a console interface utility designed to read arguments from the command-line. These arguments are then processed to copy image media files to a target directory, sorting them by their Date Taken metadata property.

    During the process, it updates each file's creation date, last modification time, and last access time to align with the corresponding Date Taken property. The sorted list can be either in an ascending (default) or descending chronological order.

    Change History:

    • Version 1.0 - Initial release by Trevor Maggs on 16 July 2024
    Since:
    16 July 2024
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

      • BatchConsole

        private BatchConsole(BatchImageEngine.Builder builder)
              throws BatchErrorException
        Constructs a new instance of this class, employing a Builder design pattern to process the specified parameters and update the copied image files. The actual Builder implementation exists in the superclass, BatchImageEngine.
        Parameters:
        builder - the Builder object containing parameters for constructing this instance.
        Throws:
        BatchErrorException - in case of an error during batch processing

    • Method Detail

      • copyToTarget

        protected void copyToTarget()
                     throws BatchErrorException
        Copies files from the source directory to the target directory, renaming each file with the designated prefix. It also modifies the time-stamp attributes of each file, specifically creation time, last modified time, and last accessed time to align with the Date Taken metadata property.
        Specified by:
        copyToTarget in class BatchImageEngine
        Throws:
        BatchErrorException - in case of an error during batch processing
